Source: http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20060605/od_nm/ukraine_lion_dc
 
 KIEV (Reuters) - A man shouting that God would keep him safe was mauled
 to death by a lioness in Kiev zoo after he crept into the animal's
 enclosure, a zoo official said on Monday.
 
 "The man shouted 'God will save me, if he exists', lowered himself
 by a rope into the enclosure, took his shoes off and went up to the
 lions," the official said.
 
 "A lioness went straight for him, knocked him down and severed his
 carotid artery."
 
 The incident, Sunday evening when the zoo was packed with visitors, as
 the first of its kind at the attraction. Lions and tigers are kept in
 an "animal island" protected by thick concrete blocks.

 There's a modern parable I've heard, that applies to this whole issue, that goes something like this:A guy is on his roof in a flood, and waters are rising quickly. A rescue helicopter comes along and he tells them "no, it's ok, God will rescue me." Eventually a boat comes along to rescue him, but he tells them "no, no need, God will rescue me." Eventually another helicopter comes and he tells them the same thing. The waters creep up over his head, and he drowns.
 
 When he gets to heaven, he frustratingly asks God "why didn't you make good on your Word and answer my prayers and rescue me?"
 
 God replies: "I sent you 2 helicopters and a boat, for cryin' out loud!"
